comments:
This is new to 3.0RC1.  If you do not define
eclipse.application=org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench in your config.ini when
branding the platform, eclipse crashes on startup generating the following log:

!SESSION Jun 02, 2004 14:55:49.993 ---------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I200405290105
java.version=1.4.1_02
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_CA
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Jun 02, 2004 14:55:49.993
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.util.Hashtable.put(Hashtable.java:389)
	at java.util.Properties.setProperty(Properties.java:102)
	at java.lang.System.setProperty(System.java:654)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:308)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:273)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:128)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:185)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:638)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:622)

Has a default value been removed since M9?

Bummer that we fail with an NPE. should fix that.

What is the product set to?  What is that product's applicatoin defined as?

The short answer is yes, there is no default application.  The config.ini that 
we ship with identifies org.eclpise.platform as the product.  This should 
identify the appropriate application.  If there is something wrong in that 
chain, no application will be defined and Eclipse will not know what to do.

The product is set to my branding plugin - which I don't believe sets an
application (hence the NPE).  How do I define an application in my branding
plugin?  DO I have to extend the org.eclipse.core.runtime.applications and set
it to org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench?

BTW - I know this is something I am doing wrong (failing to define the app), btu
it worked fine in M9 so I never noticed...

OK - I thought I figured it out - just specify
application="org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench" in feature.xml like the
org.eclipse.platform feature does.  Well, unfortunately that doesn't work
either.  It still crashes with a NPE unless I explicitly set
eclipse.application=org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench in config.ini.  This isn't too
bog of a deal but I would like to know why the org.eclipse.platform feature gets
away with it and I can't.

yes, it did work previously because Update wsa being helpful.  This caused 
other problems so they backed off.

I suspect you are splitting the idea and defining a product extension and then 
trying to spec some of the required info in a feature somehow.  You only have 
to list the id of the application in the markup for your product. 
   <product application="some app id here" name="some name">
should do fine.
Are things working for you now?

Actually - I think specifying application= in feature.xml worked.  I think it
appeared *not* to work before because of some sort of caching going on with the
platform.  It seems that after unzipping a fresh runtime and inserting my
product branding plugins, the problem went away.

I haven't gone back and verified that the removing it and installing with a
fresh platform reproduced the NPE.  Sorry - if I get time I'll try to verify
what exactly fixed my problem.

sigh.  Bugzilla and its driving need to advance you to the next bug report.  
reopening...
*** Bug 67727 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Things appear to be working as designed so we are closing this bug.

Before closing however, I want to put in a null check so that the failure mode 
is more like "application null not found" rather than an NPE.  This is somewhat 
more informative to the user and will thus save some time and frustration 
(hopefully).
+1 to fix and release for RC3.

I can confirm that this is a duplicate.  I tried the work arounds mentioned 
below and my primary feature started.  The key was to specify 
application="org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench" in the feature.xml and config.ini.

I note also that our preferred perspective is now coming up correctly for the 
first time!

The null check has een released.  Closing as fixed.

Phil, I am very curious if you had to specify the app in both the feature and 
the config.ini.  This should not be the case and in fact, is not the case for 
the Eclipse SDK.

I found I had to specify the feature and app in config.ini

This was not necessary in M8 where I only specified the feature.
*** Bug 68532 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
